title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Castelão (Lisboa)
description: This wine comes from the oldest vines in the estate. Richly fruity, it has dense blackberry flavors as well as layers of tannins. The dry core of the wine and its acidity promise aging. Solid and ripe, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Essentia 2016 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Lovely, bright notes of green citrus, pear, greengage and fig set the stage for this crisp, refreshing white, with secondary hints of fresh straw, lanolin and strawberry hull add additional layers of interest. The palate boasts a fresh, chalky mineral texture, with a final hint of just-toasted almond on the evolving close. Drink now–2023.

title: Raats Family 2015 Dolomite Cabernet Franc (Stellenbosch)
description: Earthy tones of fresh tilled soil, licorice root and sweet char lead the bouquet of this wine, grounded by the ripe black-fruit core. Velvety in texture, yet somewhat firm in structure, the palate boasts flavors of ripe black cherry and berry that carry through to the finish alongside hints of curing spice and hickory smoke. Drink now–2021.

title: Robert Craig 2015 Poggio Howell Mountain Cuvée Red (Howell Mountain)
description: This is made from two estate vineyards in partnership with a restaurant, Poggio, in Sausalito, where the winery owner lives. Combining 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, 6% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec into its own unique cuvée, and then aged in less oak than many of the winery's other wines to make it pairable with Poggio's cuisine, it offers mountain notes of sage, leather, cedar and graphite within a dense, structured frame of chocolate-covered blackberry.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from three famous vineyards in the appellation shows intriguing aromas of candied raspberry with hints of sage, thyme, star anise and pickled rose petals. It's light and easy on the palate, with flavors of hibiscus and cranberry. Goes down fast.

title: Stark-Condé 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)
description: There's a leathery, tobacco-like seam throughout this dark and masculine Cab, adding intrigue to the black plum and cassis core. Hints of char and roasted coffee give a rich impression to the palate, which feels plush and velvety in texture yet well-structured and defined. The finish is long and evolving, with an enduring grip and final notes of cigar box and black-fruit skin. Drink 2021–2025.

title: Styring 2016 Whimsy Riesling (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Though disconcertingly packaged in a Burgundy bottle (hence the whimsy?) this is another delicious Riesling from Styring. Rolling fruit flavors of apple, pear, peach and tangerine support pink-grapefruit acids. It's tangy and tasty, not too tart, and persists through a clean, crisp finish.

title: Thacher 2014 Triumvirate Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of Zinfandel from Bailey Ranch, Will's Hills and Osgood Farms offers aromas of dark strawberry, black cherry and a dusty baked-earth minerality. The dark black fruit is prominent on the sip, where richness is central to the experience, with hints of dried marjoram giving depth and a rising acidity on the finish.

title: Villa Crespia 2008 Francesco Iacono Riserva Dosaggio Zero  (Franciacorta)
description: Unusual and delicate aromas include dried herb, graphite and balsamic notes that carry over to the refined palate along with Golden Delicious, lemon zest and toasted bread crust. A walnut note closes the finish.

title: Viña Vilano 2014 Terra Incógnita  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A chocolaty, well-oaked nose with minerality and core cassis aromas is contradicted by a juicy palate with bright acidity and tension. Dry, salty flavors of berry and cassis are mildly toasted, while this wine is peppery and snappy on an acid-driven finish. The acid level on this wine suggests more aging; drink through 2032.

title: Weingut Albert Gessinger 2016 Caldo Infernale Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Alte Reben Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sun-kissed yellow cherry and mango notes are juxtaposed by struck flint, salt and slate in this spry yet powerfully fruity Riesling. The midpalate is sweet and spicy yet intensely mineral, reverberating through a long, stony finish. Drinks well already but likely to improve from 2021.
designation: Caldo Infernale Zeltinger Sonnenuhr Alte Reben Auslese

title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Leonardini Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Fleshy and fully tannic, this is a big bold 100% varietal red from one estate. Dried herb, cedar and black current give it a classic character of savory seasoning and appropriate herbaceousness.

title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Mancino Lanciatore Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, made in a dark concentrated style that's perfumed in cherry blossom. Taut sinewy layers of cassis and ever-present tannin combine effortlessly into a seamless whole, with accents of cedar and graphite.

title: Xanadu 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Quite young and powerful at the moment, this broody Margaret River Cabernet offers up ripe cherry, mocha, florals and dusty, herbal oak notes. The palate is rich and plush, with more oak driven herbacousness, chewy tannins and a savory finish. Set this in the cellar for a few years and try it again with some more age on it. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Old Vine Petite Sirah (Fair Play)
description: This wine has a compelling, exuberant black-fruit character that makes it taste alive and buoyant despite a thick layer of fine-grained tannin and very full body. Blackberry jam, black cherry compote and dark chocolate power the flavors and linger on the finish.

title: Château Bourgneuf 2015  Pomerol
description: Powerful tannins give a dense wine, rich with ripe black fruits and solid tannins. The acidity and the weight of the fruit hold the promise for the future of this concentrated wine. Don't drink before 2026.

title: Château Chemin-Royal 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: A firmly structured wine, this is powerful and dense. It comes from a 14-acre property dominated by Merlot that gives the wine weight, rich fruit and juicy acidity. The result is a wood-aged wine full of spice and with a dry core that is packed with fruit. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Cheval Brun 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: Owned by the Rivière family, which also owns a Saint-Émilion-based negociant firm, this estate has produced a generous, ripe wine. The 85% Merlot in the blend gives a jammy, rich character that will soften and broaden as the wine matures. A firm structure within the rich fruitiness will allow the wine to develop. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Dasvin-Bel-Air 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same ownership as Château Maucamps, this southern Médoc property has made a wine that is rich in both tannins and fruit. It has ripe tannins and great black currant fruits from a blend almost equally balanced between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The wine needs to age and will be ready from 2022.

title: Château Fonréaud 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: The Chanfreau family continues its skilled course with this ripe, full and rich wine. Tannins from both the fruit and wood are prominent, giving a dry character to this youthful wine. However, the rich black-currant fruit is developing well. This wine has a long-term future. Drink from 2025.

title: Château la Commanderie 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: This wine has weight and rich fruit. It also offers the tannins and structure associated with Saint-Estèphe, which balance the generous potential of the blackberry flavors. Half-and-half Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Martinat 2015 Cuvée Epicurea  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: The luxury cuvée from this estate, this blend includes 70% Merlot and 30% Malbec. It is still wood laden, with strongly toasty flavors that are balanced by opulent black fruits and firm tannins that promise a richly succulent wine. It will need plenty of time, so don't drink before 2022.

title: Château Pomeys 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: A half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend, this wine is richly structured and packed with fruit. It has a perfumed character, juicy with blackberry flavors and acidity. Drink this opulent Patrick Meynard wine from 2024.

title: Buty 2014 Columbia Rediviva Phinny Hill Vineyard Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Coming from an up-and-coming vineyard, this wine is 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah. It's aromatically expressive, with notes of ripe black cherry, plum, licorice and high-toned dried herbs. The palate is dense and layered, showing breadth and richness while staying in balance. Drink in the near term.

title: Buty 2014 Rediviva of the Stones Rockgarden Estate Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a unique blend of 77% Syrah, 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Mourvèdre. Hailing from the Rocks District, it offers generous aromas of black olive, plum, wet gravel, crushed flower, green olive, smoked meat, parsley and dried herb. These lead to pure, ample fruit and savory flavors. A taste of smoked meat lingers on the finish.
designation: Rediviva of the Stones Rockgarden Estate

title: Ca' del Bosco 2013 Vintage Collection Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Made entirely with Chardonnay, this elegant sparkler offers aromas of yellow stone fruit and white spring flower. The creamy palate delivers ripe yellow apple, crushed herb and tangerine zest  alongside a soft perlage.

title: 2Hawk 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: Malbec shines in Southern Oregon. Here it's given 16 months in new French oak, emerging supple with tangy berry and pie cherry fruit. Suggestions of citrus juice come with balancing acidity. Tannins are ripe, substantial and lightly earthy, with a hint of coffee.

title: Antico Colle 2013 Il Saggio Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Blue flower, plum cake and baking spice aromas come to the forefront while a whiff of tilled earth lingers in the background. The elegant firmly structured palate shows raspberry preserves, star anise and espresso set against taut, polished tannins. Drink 2019–2028.

title: Bellavista 2013 Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Enticing scents of white spring blossoms and yellow stone fruit waft out of the glass. The bright creamy palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, juicy citrus zest, white almond and white peach flavors alongside an elegant perlage.

title: Château Cantin 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a dense wine with solid with tannins, as well as crisp black currant fruit flavors, promising to age well. It is a solid effort, fruity yet seriously structured. With its obvious aging potential, drink from 2023.
